dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Relativity Space just secured a massive $135 million to launch their 3D-printed Terran 1 rocket from the Kennedy Space Center.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Relativity Space just secured a massive one hundred thirty five dollars million to launch their 3D-printed Terran one rocket from the Kennedy Space Center.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The $140 million fundraise brings the total amount of investment in the company to $185 million. Its rocket will launch from Cape Canaveral.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and that brings their total funding up to, what, $180 million? That's huge for a startup in this crowded small rocket market.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and that brings their total funding up to, what, one hundred eighty dollars million? That's huge for a startup in this crowded small rocket market.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The $140 million fundraise brings the total amount of investment in the company to $185 million.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly—over a hundred companies are trying to do this, but only Rocket Lab has actually sent commercial payloads to orbit so far.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly-over a hundred companies are trying to do this, but only Rocket Lab has actually sent commercial payloads to orbit so far.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: There are over 100 startups now in the race to build small rockets, which are made for smaller satellites that have become increasingly popular as new hardware allows companies to build satellites at a fraction of the size and cost of traditional car-sized satellites. However, only one of those companiesthe L.A.-based Rocket Labhas launched commercial payloads to orbit.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, so Relativity's betting big on their manufacturing edge—like, they're literally 3D-printing the entire rocket, engines and all.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, so Relativity's betting big on their manufacturing edge-like, they're literally 3D-printing the entire rocket, engines and all.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The company is 3D-printing its rockets, from the engine to the structure, and has recently seen success in building first and second stages of its Terran 1 design.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: With those Stargate printers they built. Tim Ellis says once the factory's fully operational, they can produce rockets way faster than traditional methods.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: With those Stargate printers they built. Tim Ellis says once the factory's fully operational, they can produce rockets way faster than traditional methods.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: To that end, the company has built four large 3D-printers, which it calls Stargate, at its manufacturing facility. Once engineering is complete and the factory is fully built, Ellis says, his company will be able to produce and iterate rockets very quickly.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And they've already got customers lined up—Telesat, mu Space, Spaceflight… that's pretty impressive for a company that hasn't launched yet.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And they've already got customers lined up-Telesat, mu Space, Spaceflight... that's pretty impressive for a company that hasn't launched yet.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The company has signed deals with Canadian communications company Telesat to deliver internet satellites to orbit, with Thai company mu Space, and with Spaceflight, which will use the rocket to launch several of its customers satellites.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: At $10.5 million per launch, it's competitive too. But honestly, what really caught my attention was Ellis's long-term vision—3D-printing on Mars?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: At ten point five dollars million per launch, it's competitive too. But honestly, what really caught my attention was Ellis's long-term vision-3D-printing on Mars?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Launches cost $10 million, in the ballpark of current satellite launches.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh yeah, he mentioned building infrastructure on Mars one day. Ambitious doesn't even cover it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh yeah, he mentioned building infrastructure on Mars one day. Ambitious doesn't even cover it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Part of our long-term vision is one day 3D-printing rockets and infrastructure on Mars, he says.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And it's cool that Mark Cuban's involved—he was their first investor and joined this round too, along with Bond and Tribe Capital.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And it's cool that Mark Cuban's involved-he was their first investor and joined this round too, along with Bond and Tribe Capital.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Los Angeles-based startup has a lot of believers, including billionaire Mark Cuban, the companys first investor and also a participant in the current round, which was led by Noah Knauf at Bond fund and Tribe Capital.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: You know, with that kind of backing and their tech approach, they might actually be one of the few that survive this industry shakeout.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: You know, with that kind of backing and their tech approach, they might actually be one of the few that survive this industry shakeout.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. The next couple years are gonna be make-or-break for so many of these startups.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. The next couple years are gonna be make-or-break for so many of these startups.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But if anyone can scale up quickly thanks to 3D printing, it might just be Relativity.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But if anyone can scale up quickly thanks to 3D printing, it might just be Relativity.
